name: Tanacetum vulgare
Relationship: Compare: CIMICIF.; CINA; ABSINTH. NUX follows well.

Head: Heavy, dull, confused
Headache with least exertion
Mind: Mental fatigue, nausea and vertigo, worse in a closed room
Abdomen: Pain in bowels; relieved by stool
Desire for stool immediately after eating
Female: Dysmenorrhoea, with bearing-down pains, tenderness, drawing in groins
Ears: Roaring and ringing; voice sounds strange; EARS SEEM TO CLOSE UP SUDDENLY

details: Abnormal lassitude. Nervous and tired feeling. "Half dead, half alive feeling" all over. Of use in chorea and reflex spasms (worms). Said to be a specific against effects of poison ivy.
